p: In a post hoc analysis of the ICE study, almost half of IVIg responders showed improvement in adjusted INCAT disability scores within the first 3 weeks of treatment (ie, after the initial 2.0 g/kg loading dose). 18 To be comparable with data from the ICE study, 3 the primary endpoint of the ProCID study will be the proportion of patients in the IVIg 1.0 g/kg group with response to treatment, as defined by an improvement from baseline of â‰¥1 point on the adjusted INCAT disability score. Consistent with the ICE 3 and Privigen Impact on Mobility and Autonomy (PRIMA) 7 studies, the primary endpoint of this study will be assessed at week 24.
